document.title: WIDA Can Do Descriptors: Grade Level Cluster 3-5

852E8F6C3FA04C6A80E28D88DB589D96.description:
Connect or integrate
personal experiences with
literature/content

B2AAD88B3DAB492E92FFF848FFDC4145.description:
Apply content-based
information to new
contexts

0A4C9F15435D4687BBF00C52D8AF43ED.description:
Produce extended responses
of original text approaching
grade level

0D041BFF0D9D49E1BF8D67513C8741DE.description:
Explain strategies or use
of information in solving
problems

2B4E11F6B9DE4528A3311C6B44477DA1.description:
Author multiple forms of
writing (e.g., expository,
narrative, persuasive) from
models

0F05C53FA5EC4C7799E7B3CBF01ABFBA.description:
Produce simple expository
or narrative text

29830456482E42ED945069B47FA5E6F2.description:
Make comparisons using
real-life or visuallysupported
materials

A2699B7A026F49668C963DE8199E515C.description:
Fill in graphic organizers,
charts, and tables

DC4E8FF325684F248F2CE826C00B74BD.description:
Complete/produce
sentences from word/
phrase banks or walls

073FE3487B9745BB87FCC5C638A74A4C.description:
Make lists from labels or
with peers

4DBDE5BAFB174BF3A1DEDC286A11A5BE.description:
Answer oral questions with
single words

BB91C080945D413DBD8B3A341BCD6251.description:
Copy words, phrases, and
short sentences

74CC2A9EB8CF4EB883624B5278677306.description:
Label objects, pictures, or
diagrams from word/phrase
banks

208B444ABA9047A2A9F4953FD2DB9EB4.description:
Draw conclusions from
explicit and implicit text
at or near grade level

27D233FC86014AFABA7F3513E97C56BB.description:
Identify, explain, and give
examples of figures of
speech

BF9B5373690046E7A770ABF6672D1EC3.description:
Answer analytical questions
about grade-level text

7FEC4E4D304F410BA952B5FC7DE63E4F.description:
Summarize information
from multiple related
sources

D178A543B46A4948970B2E0A1A9F7556.description:
Differentiate between fact
and opinion in narrative
and expository text

60907DE9FF8D423480317F4CE80E5F2A.description:
Find details that support
main ideas

378954B34E784430905F191AB4DE1E4A.description:
Match graphic organizers
to different texts (e.g.,
compare/contrast with
Venn diagram)

5B8D6E5930FF40678FD20626A3D3A106.description:
Classify features of various
genres of text (e.g., “and
they lived happily ever
after”—fairy tales)

A4853B44417249A7A79C501F60CBF8B1.description:
Use context clues and
illustrations to determine
meaning of words/phrases

B0ADF85711B44AE19A36ED9A1E64387D.description:
Sequence events in stories
or content-based processes

CB0EF5CAD63449BD9794EF8F8D2DECE2.description:
Identify main ideas and
some details

F17EA74E0E914CB5B94C14B2BF287F54.description:
Interpret information
or data from charts and
graphs

2EDBC7C1339E4F858301A3323D729C70.description:
Follow visually supported
written directions (e.g.,
“Draw a star in the sky.”)

D493427B04ED4751BF303A2C3E7BBA61.description:
Identify elements of story
grammar (e.g., characters,
setting)

0AF4E8A523EC42DA92EEC61AA17E55A7.description:
Find changes to root words
in context

31D0F38824A2496E96D1309E93164A35.description:
Identify facts and explicit
messages from illustrated
text

4B6B58C9D19C4467A31EEB4EA620A203.description:
Match illustrated words/
phrases in differing
contexts (e.g., on the
board, in a book)

107796F49FD24CFAB91751A644055C8C.description:
Identify cognates from first
language, as applicable

D0187BAEBB5A4E24B13A31AB6BE6A161.description:
Match icons or diagrams
with words/concepts

7461F7794ED74AE68188AAF5AB42BABC.description:
Explain in detail results
of inquiry (e.g., scientific
experiments)

2B522B91409B43C7B6C3E4A8F784B85A.description:
Give content-based
presentations using
technical vocabulary

5B41DF5A217F42E8BD5CAE4169F41C94.description:
Justify/defend opinions or
explanations with evidence

C1D26939E5954B80B06E4973CD5EA469.description:
Answer opinion questions
with supporting details

98780E1CC9C141A0827D30A1571C123D.description:
Make predictions or
hypotheses from discourse

0F7FB03EBA74457E888D1EE914A7BF46.description:
Share basic social
information with peers

681949B7FB9D4A6CAA04D3FD904A1696.description:
Describe pictures, events,
objects, or people using
phrases or short sentences

DB3AF765F444450CB59DFEAA2FF7720A.description:
Ask simple, everyday
questions (e.g., “Who is
absent?”)

35EBE9FC3E7F4DB08395F34B745C2395.description:
Recite words or phrases
from pictures of everyday
objects and oral modeling

34C2E010A8B043ADB27A7EB4B0F4B7B3.description:
Name pre-taught objects,
people, diagrams, or
pictures

F6EFFA02D301456980AD2F3039FEA2E4.description:
Form opinions of people,
places, or ideas from oral
scenarios

BEC33333C54C4EAA9162552D1C8B7986.description:
Distinguish between literal
and figurative language in
oral discourse

53B0DD048FC44F3198454876B8F5ED2F.description:
Construct models or use
manipulatives to problemsolve
based on oral
discourse

C84CC28C23384BEFB3F905B76314BEF7.description:
Carry out oral instructions
containing grade-level,
content-based language

15F24E61809147D59807F3DD9BAC9BED.description:
Role play the work of
authors, mathematicians,
scientists, historians from
oral readings, videos, or
multi-media

471A1A21B71A4BEEA09F1DA25B6791A0.description:
Infer from and act on oral
information

A315A7BCA9A34D4FAF0E9E60FDC75FCD.description:
Identify illustrated main
ideas and supporting details
from oral discourse

7E93887B3C2549BD961A061D34BE52AA.description:
Interpret oral information
and apply to new situations

DAE01B9168F9449F8917E6A53A409299.description:
Sequence pictures from
oral stories, processes, or
procedures

FA449510B72F4E5F8AA2186C7735DA32.description:
Match literal meanings of
oral descriptions or oral
reading to illustrations

BAE2F111A65A468DA7454A2984323B9E.description:
Identify illustrated main
ideas from paragraph-level
oral discourse

E2982C77C24F4C1A943AD88B7605526F.description:
Evaluate oral information
(e.g., about lunch options)

0BF6CF8E0D3F48E0BA89C8125F80351E.description:
Draw in response to oral
descriptions

253160B5AB7B4E4882FAD4ECEAF3617C.description:
Arrange pictures or objects
per oral information

78EDE058701441CEB7BE2681EE1F374F.description:
Categorize content-based
pictures or objects from
oral descriptions

B6A2EFCD3D81433F9D925B0D45E88357.description:
Match classroom oral
language to daily routines

F04651CF254B46E9ADB2132DDD031B85.description:
Identify objects, figures,
people from oral statements
or questions (e.g., “Which
one is a rock?”)

B01D32273F054DCAA96761BACEAE74A4.description:
Follow one-step oral
directions (e.g., physically
or through drawings)

5DEEB17BBEA845C68EB710205095D612.description:
Point to stated pictures,
words, or phrases
